question: Where is the micturition reflex center located?
Disturbance in the renal reabsorption of bicarbonates in the proximal tubules leads to which one of the following?
If plasma colloidal osmotic pressure is 40 mmHg, renal capillary pressure is 60 mmHg, and Bowman's capsule hydrostatic pressure is 18 mmHg, which of the following effect occurs in the kidney?
The examination of a cross-section of kidneys shows the renal columns of Bertin. Which statement best defines the renal columns of Bertin?

answers.option: Cortical substance that extends into medulla
Medullary substance that extends into cortex
Nephrons that are drained by a common collecting duct

question: Which of the following provides arterial supply to the pelvic part of the ureter?
Which of the following is not the part of renal filtration barrier?
What may the kidneys enhance in response to acidosis?
Allopurinol is a structural analog of which of the following compounds?
What is the osmolarity of the glomerular filtrate that enters the proximal convoluted tubule?
Increased secretion of aldosterone leads to which of the following?
A female comes into the clinic with oral ulcers, hematuria, and +1 proteinuria. 1-2 white blood cells/HPF are found on urinalysis. What is the most probable diagnosis?
Which of the following is the narrowest part of the ureter, well above the urinary bladder, where stones can get lodged?
Which of the following is the correct order of the coverings of the kidneys from outwards to inwards?

answers.option: Perinephric fat - Renal fascia - Paranephric fat - Renal capsule
Renal fascia - Perinephric fat - Paranephric fat - Renal capsule
Paranephric fat - Renal fascia - Perinephric fat - Renal capsule
Renal capsule - Renal fascia - Perinephric fat - Paranephric fat
Renal capsule - Paranephric fat - Perinephric fat - Renal fascia

question: Which of the following arteries is responsible for the arterial supply to the proximal part of the ureter?

A 6-year-old female is brought to the urology clinic with the complaint of urinary incontinence. Further investigation revealed that the urine was not coming from the bladder, but was continuously dribbling from the vagina. What is the most appropriate diagnosis for this patient?

Microscopically the Bowman's capsule comprises an inner visceral layer and an outer parietal layer. Cells lining the visceral layer have a star-shaped body with primary and secondary processes. Which of the following cells best fits this description?
Which part of the urogenital sinus gives rise to the urethra in females?

answers.option: Widest part of the urogenital sinus
Pelvic part of the urogenital sinus
Phallic part of the urogenital sinus
Vesical part of the urogenital sinus

question: In a healthy individual, what percentage of renal plasma flow would you expect to be passed into the glomerular capsule?
Which of the following structures is most involved in concentrating the urine?
Which type of transport is exhibited by the Na-K-2Cl transporter in the apical membrane of the thick ascending loop of Henle?
What is the tonicity of urine as it enters the renal collecting duct?

answers.option: Hypotonic or isotonic, but never hypertonic
Hypertonic or isotonic, but never hypotonic

question: All of the glucose is absorbed by the proximal convoluted tubule. Approximately 90% is in the first part of the proximal convoluted tubule. Which of the following transporters is responsible for transporting the major amount of glucose from the tubular lumen into the cell?

A one-year-old boy was admitted to the hospital with complaints of diarrhea and vomiting. On examination, he is lethargic, and weak and on pinching the abdominal skin it goes back very slowly. Which IV fluid should be given to rehydrate the child?

Anti-glomerular basement membrane antibody-induced glomerulonephritis accounts for less than 5% cases of human glomerulonephritis. Which of the following is the most appropriate example of this nephropathy?
Which of the following statements is most appropriate regarding renal transplantation?

answers.option: Allergen test is performed on potential recipient
Immunosuppressant drugs are prescribed to selected transplant patients
ABO compatibility between donor and recipient is essential
HLA compatibility for minor antigens is not required
HLA compatibility is sometimes not required

question: A substance "X" has the following properties: Urinary concentration (U) = 0 mg/ml Plasma concentration (P) = 13.6 mg/ml. If a patient has a urinary flow rate (V) of 2 ml/min, what is the renal clearance rate of X?

If a patient has a glomerular filtration rate of 100 ml/min and is known to be clearing a therapeutic drug at a rate of 150 ml/min, what is the most appropriate comment regarding the renal processing of this drug?

answers.option: Overall processing of this drug is similar to amino acids
Tm of drug has been exceeded, causing clearance to rise above GFR
Since the clearance is greater than GFR, the drug must be reabsorbed
Since the clearance is greater than GFR, the drug must be secreted
No evaluation can be made without further information

question: A one-year-old boy presents to the emergency with a complaint of weakness and growth retardation. He is lethargic and anemic. Blood analysis reveals megaloblastic anemia and urinalysis shows orotic aciduria. Which of the following compounds is most likely to alleviate his symptoms?
A patient presents with confusion and has a sodium level of 123 mEq/l. He is diagnosed with syndrome of inappropriate antidiuretic hormone secretion (SIADH). Which type of hyponatremia is this?
Which of the following organisms is the most common cause of community-acquired urinary tract infections?
Which of the following is least frequently associated with focal segmental glomerulosclerosis?
Which of the following is least likely to be seen in nephrotic syndrome?
Which of the following is least likely to be correct about xanthogranulomatous pyelonephritis?

answers.option: Accumulation of foamy macrophages with plasma cells, lymphocytes and giant cells

question: A researcher is conducting a research study to find the prevalence of diabetes mellitus in Karachi city. Which of the following epidemiological study design is the most appropriate for this research?
A patient presents to the emergency room with complaints of diarrhea and vomiting for one day. He is semi-conscious and severely dehydrated. What is the first-line management in this patient?
Which of the following is a cause of pre-renal acute kidney failure?
A 65-year-old female with chronic kidney disease secondary to hypertension has low erythropoietin levels. Which of the following conditions is the patient at risk of developing?
What is the investigation of choice to diagnose vesicoureteric reflux in a male toddler?

answers.option: Ultrasound bladder with pre and post void volumes

question: Which of the following vessels gives rise to the renal arteries?
Which of the following structures enters the kidney at the hilum and brings blood to the kidneys?
Which of the following are direct branches of the renal arteries?
Which part of the renal tubule is impermeable to water, while solutes can pass out passively into medullary interstitial space?

answers.option: Descending limb of loop of Henle
Thick ascending limb of loop of Henle
Thin ascending limb of loop of Henle

question: During your posting in the behavioral sciences department, you were taught about informational care and how sharing the patient's personal information is sometimes important for the patient's care. Which of the following individuals is "authorized" to know the patient's personal information?

answers.option: Another worker from the care team providing support to the individual
A senior worker not involved in supporting the individual
A family member of the patient
Another health worker from another team providing care to another individual

question: In a patient with severe dehydration, which organ/s become/s non-functional almost immediately?
In which segment of the renal tubule are the sodium-hydrogen antiporters that are involved in hydrogen ion secretion located?

A 46-year-old male presents to the emergency room with severe right toe pain. On examination, he had a temperature of 100.8° F, and he was moderately distressed about the pain in his toe. The right big toe was swollen, warm, red, and exquisitely tender. Synovial joint fluid was obtained and revealed rod or needle-shaped crystals. Which enzyme(s) is/are deficient in this patient?
Which of the following best describes the urine of diabetic patients?
Which of the following serves as a cofactor in de novo purine synthesis?

A 60-year-old male with a history of diabetes and chronic kidney failure presents to the clinic with complaints of dyspnea, cough, malaise, and fever for 15 days. How can the glomerular filtration rate be determined in this patient?

A 55-year-old male with COPD presents to the clinic with increased severity of shortness of breath. His immediate arterial blood gases show respiratory acidosis. What is the first step in the interpretation of arterial blood gases?

A 40-year-old female with a history of breast carcinoma was brought to the critical care unit with the complication of metastasis. The patient's family was counseled about minimal chances of survival. However, the family was not convinced by your opinion and wished to consult a second specialist. What is the responsibility of the doctor in this scenario?

answers.option: Support the decision of second opinion

question: What percentage of the total body weight does the extra-cellular fluid (ECF) account for?
The renal sinus is a space within the kidney containing all the structures responsible for draining urine into the ureter. Which of the following structures is present in this space?
Which of the following is the most common site for an ectopic kidney?
Which of the following results in an uninhibited neurogenic bladder?

answers.option: Spinal cord injury above sacral region
Partial injury of spinal cord or brainstem

question: Which of the following hormones or autocoids can increase the glomerular filtration rate (GFR) by decreasing vascular resistance in the glomerular capillaries?

A 5-year-old boy presents to the outpatient clinic with generalized and periorbital edema. Blood tests and urine analysis reveal hypoalbuminemia, lipiduria, and 3.7 g proteinuria. A renal biopsy is performed. Which of the following electron microscopic features is most likely to be present in this case?

answers.option: Thick glomerular basement membrane with immune complex deposition
Effacement of foot process but no deposits

question: The parents of an 11-year-old mentally impaired male child visit a local clinic. The father tells the doctor that he has 7 other children to support and someone suggested that he could sell the kidney of his mentally impaired son. What is the correct legal implication in this case according to the "Transplantation of Human Organs and Tissues Act 2010"?

answers.option: It is illegal to sell a kidney and should not be done
It can be sold since parents provide their consent
It is legal because patient is mentally impaired
It can only be donated to a relative

question: The enzyme carbonic anhydrase catalyzes the formation of which of the following compounds?
The Na-K-2Cl cotransporters are present in which of the following parts of a nephron?

answers.option: Descending limb of loop of Henle
Thick ascending limb of loop of Henle
Thin descending limb of loop of Henle

question: The synthesis of deoxyribonucleotides from ribonucleotides requires the enzyme ribonucleotide reductase. Which of the following is a cofactor for this enzyme?
Which of the following is the most common route of spread of acute pyelonephritis?

answers.option: Ascending spread from urethra and bladder

question: In the process of pyrimidine metabolism, the deamination of cytosine produces which of the following compounds?
A doctor is performing a nephrostomy. Which of the following regions of the body is most appropriate to approach the kidney?

answers.option: Superior part of the pelvic cavity

question: Mycophenolic acid is used as an immunosuppressant drug to prevent graft rejection after transplant. Which of the following enzymes is inhibited by this drug?
Which of the following factors help distinguish that hematuria is of renal origin and not from the bladder?
Under the action of which of the following hormones is potassium secreted from the principal cells of the late distal tubules and collecting ducts?
Which of the following ions is secreted by the principal cells when stimulated by aldosterone?
Which of the following nerves supplies the sensory innervation to the bladder?
Which of the following is the most commonly used test to assess renal function?
Which of the following structures is most likely to be damaged during the surgical approach of kidneys around the 11th or 12th rib?

Which of the following cells associated with the glomerular capillaries are involved in phagocytosis of macromolecules, adjusting filtration rate, mediating immune response in a glomerulus, and providing structural support?
The decrease in sodium chloride (NaCl) concentration in the glomerular filtrate, when sensed by the macula densa is most likely to result in which of the following responses?

answers.option: Increased release of renin from juxtaglomerular cells
Inhibition of renin release from juxtaglomerular cells

question: A histopathologist observes a slide of the wall of the urinary bladder with three distinct layers the mucosa, muscularis, and serosa. Which of the following parts of the bladder is under observation?
Which of the following conditions results in efflux of potassium ions from the cell?
Aspartate enters the Krebs cycle as which of the following compounds?

Which of the following parts of the male urethra is lined by pseudostratified columnar epithelium?
